directions: Toast coriander seeds in dry pan until fragrant. Pound to a powder using pestle and mortar.
Rub chicken thighs with a little oil, salt, pepper, saffron threads, ground cinnamon, ginger and toasted coriander.
Cover and marinate in fridge for at least 1 hour or overnight.

Heat 3 tbsp (45 mL) oil in tagine or casserole dish over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic, 2 tbsp (30 mL) of the almonds, the ginger, cinnamon stick and a good pinch of salt. Cook until onions are translucent. Transfer to a plate and without washing the pan, add the chicken thighs. Turn up heat to high and brown the chicken skins. Return onion mix to pan. Pour in enough water to cover the chicken and bring to boil. Reduce the heat and put the lid on and simmer for 1 hour, stirring every so often.
Add the dates, orange peel, maple syrup and half the coriander and simmer for 20 minutes until the sauce is thick and syrupy.
Rinse the preserved lemon well under running water, removing as much salt as possible. Scoop out and discard the flesh and thinly slice the skin.
Sprinkle lemon, remaining almonds and coriander over the dish.
ingredients: 6 chicken thighs, skin on, bone in
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 inch (2.5 cm) piece of ginger, peeled, finely chopped
12 Medjool dates, pitted, torn into halves
1 orange, rind peeled off in strips
title: Chicken Tagine
